website_summaries.verdict: Small phone that's easy to carry and that supports huge storage capacity microSD cards.
pros: Includes a stylus pen for easier operation
Allows for expansion of storage space of up to 2TB with a microSD memory card
Reasonable price point for this size of smartphone
Works especially well with Amazon Prime apps and features like Alexa
cons: Front and rear camera performance is only average

customer_reviews.title: Very good phone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cell phone. Upgraded from a Basic Stylo 3. Put in a Simple Mobile BYOD sim card and transferred my old number in 10 minutes. Very good camera. Has more Ram and storage than the Stylo 3. Fingerprint sensor works well. Also has a larger screen and greater resolution. The stylus seems to be easier to remove from the bottom of the phone and is a nice feature. Excellent cell phone for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Brieaddy

customer_reviews.title: It's BIG......
customer_reviews.text: Thank you LG for a great phone. If you are a professional photographer get a Camera, if your in the line of music work rent a Studio, I dont understand the negatives..... this is the best under $300 phone I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Contin

customer_reviews.title: True to the LG Stylo line! Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Im a O.G. Stylo user, i will say this Stylo feels Way heavier and better built then older models. The screen is better, bigger and more user friendly. I got a silver & blue Anccer case (minimalistic) that complements this purchase to a T! The fingerprint sensor is great and the new biometric facial recognition kicks butt! Feels good in the hand and is very responsive, the external speaker aint the greatest but it is what it is. Overall YES i would recommend this phone, YES it is a "budget Galaxy Note" type phone, but "All of US Stylo Junkies" are drawn to it like a moth to a flame!
customer_reviews.author: Donavan Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful phone, let down by poor audio, and cheap cameras
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful phone with so much going for it. Perfect fingerprint reader, works on all carriers, great screen, thin, reasonably fast. All to be let down by poor audio, and a pair of cheap cameras. Voices rattle in the earpiece when you turn up the volume. And the speakerphone, yuck. I've had $50 phones with better speakerphone audio. (The microphone is very good though, it sounds clear to the people you are calling.) Rear camera is always focusing, but results always lack detail. Color balance when using the flash isn't good and there are no adjustments in the stock camera that I could find, and I did look. Front camera always blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Will work with cricket wireless......
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Less expensive option compared to the Samsung Galaxy phones. I had no issue with it after I put the cricket sim card in. I've been using the face recognition and its extremely responsive. No lag opening the phone. I was worried about reception in my area. Its better than my old phone. Good quality video and speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I love this phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is literally nicer than just about any flagship phone ive purchased. incredible value. The software is shockingly fast to update, as you will have the latest android software MONTHS before other (samsung) phones will even think about getting updated. If it's a big name branded (verizon/att/tmobile) phone that you're waiting for updates.... forget about it. This is a solid phone, with a solid battery life, substantial amounts of still competitive tech, all in an affordable and solidly built device. This device is cheap enough to buy again if lost, and nice enough that you WILL DEFINITELY buy again if lost.
customer_reviews.author: TByrd

customer_reviews.title: WOW!  WOW!  WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I have had many phones over the years - both iPhones and Android - and this is HANDS DOWN the best phone I have ever owned. Super fast, gorgeous resolution, lightweight and packed full of fun features. I cannot believe I got such a high quality phone for this price! Thank you Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shimbalaie

customer_reviews.title: Micro SD card may eject for no reason
customer_reviews.text: I returned 2 of these and ordered a completely different phone. Both phones would eject the micro SD card for no reason. I tried reformatting the cards, buying a new SD card, and doing all fixes recommended by LG. NOTHING worked. I really liked all the features, but this bug drove me crazy. LG wanted me to send in both phones for a repair. Hope you guys have a better experience with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bala

customer_reviews.title: Best deal
customer_reviews.text: Using with metro pcs love the phone no down sides
customer_reviews.author: Don A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful phone
customer_reviews.text: Love the extra ram that the unlocked version has. So far it's very fast and the battery life is really good. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone :)
customer_reviews.text: Great unlocked phone and the facial recognition is very responsive and reliable. I wasn't sure what to expect from a mid range phone but its definitely worth it and I would buy it again . The only thing I'd say it's lacking is the front facing camera. It's not the best and not the worst .
customer_reviews.author: Allen Dierolf

customer_reviews.title: Killer camera & edit options!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Stylo 4, but so far I LOVE everything about it!!! It has a large screen, narrow profile for my small hands - great features, tons of memory, could go on & on. Just go get your own - it's fantastic! LOVE the cameras!!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the size of this phone. My hands are big so this phone is easy to handle. More than enough storage space and an additional 2tb micro can be added. But get this...IT MAKES PHONE CALLS TOO!! Whoever thought a phone would make calls!!!!?...LOL!!-just kidding. It's just that I'm not one of those people with phone addiction so this phone fits my need and allows me to do what I need to do when I'm away from my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: PHiggo

customer_reviews.title: Stylus constantly falls out!
customer_reviews.text: Overall the phone is fine, but the stylus is very loose and the slightest bump or drop can cause the pen to fall out and go flying away from the phone! Given the fact that the stylus is the whole reason to buy this phone over competitors at the same price point that have better build/specs (such as the Moto G line), I would recommend looking somewhere else
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: LG Stulo4
customer_reviews.text: First of all the phone is 6" not 6.2" so that lie need to stop. Secondly, the screen resolution does not have any where near FHD. Terrible speaker sound, no accessaries and the tray injector is actually a paper clip. Come on, for 250 bucks, is that all you can offer customers? I will not remend this phone
customer_reviews.author: alelee

customer_reviews.title: Bad screen pixel. Make sure you check yours
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy arrived with bad screen. No apparent damage to box, but it was not packaged well. As soon as I turned it on I thought I saw a bad spot. Then I couldn't because the default background is blue. I then googled for a black web page and could easily see it. Why pay for expideted shipping when you have to send it back and wait again. Very frustrating, and disappointing LG has always been a trusted product of mine.
customer_reviews.author: Family Account

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I need
customer_reviews.text: I'm still finding new features in this phone that were not on the Stylo 2 that i used for almost 4 years. It does more than i need and come to find out, many of the same features of an IPhone at a lot less cost.
customer_reviews.author: Karenbodan

customer_reviews.title: Good budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price but needs more RAM. Runs much faster if you make sure to kill your apps and not let them run in the background. Stylus works great!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Huge quality for a small price
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this phone. I have the stylo 3 also and the 4 is way more advanced. Has a ton of great features. Overall a beautiful phone great for pretty much everything from photo taking and editing to gaming and video streaming. I couldnt be happier. This is alot of phone for a cheap price very worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisley lewis

customer_reviews.title: Big and nice
customer_reviews.text: The camera quality is very poor, phone constantly froze, the phone is big and nice but disappointed with it's performance
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Get the comparable Motorola instead.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this phone again. I bought it thinking I would use the stylus for a bunch of tasks, but I don't. I find the phone to be lethargic when compared to the budget Motorola phones we have used over the past few years. I like the subtle and simple features that Motorola phones provide too. I bought the LG Stylo 4 for me and the Motorola G6 for my wife. They were about the same price and I thought I would try the LG phone while she upgrades to a bit newer Motorola G6. Again, I would not buy this phone if I could do it over again.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use for someone new to smartphones. Great value
customer_reviews.text: If you are considering buying this phone on a budget, absolutely do it. You get a lot of bang for your buck. I bought this for my dad as his first smart phone. Comparing it to my Google Pixel 2 xl, it's very comparable. The screen quality is great, the phone has plenty of power to run all but the most graphic intensive apps smoothly. My dad isn't great with technology and it only took me about two hours to get him comfortable with the phone. It feels almost like a flag ship phone. I mean, the damn thing has facial recognition and fingerprint scaninng... in a 250 dollar phone. Amazing bargain. Works well on Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Love the phone, just bummed about price drop
customer_reviews.text: Got to say I love the phone, but really bummed 2 days after I bought it ( the day it was delivered to me ) Amazon dropped the price by $40.00.......
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Roderigues

customer_reviews.title: Lg stylo 4 is a great phone.
customer_reviews.text: Love that the phone i wanted went on sale. Lots of improvements from my old stylo 1. Was preliaded with every amazon app. Guess thats part of the deal. Switched it to cricket wireless easily at store. Did rewuire new sim chip for 10 dollars because its a nano sim card. My old stylo 1 was a micro sim.
customer_reviews.author: Dane

customer_reviews.title: Poor mans version of Galaxy Note
customer_reviews.text: Has 90% functionality of Galaxy Note at 1/4 the price. Memory is limited but I’ve added 128 G SD card for extra photos, music and videos. The processor can get bogged down with many apps open. Big screen with average display. Like the stylus apps for quick memos, creating GIFS, screenshots and memos while off. Camera is average shooter but has nice bells and whistles. Only truly subpar area are the tinny speakers but if you use headset, the equalizer puts out excellent sound. Recommend if youre tired of paying grand plus for a Note.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget phone
customer_reviews.text: Switched to this from a Nexus 5X because the battery wouldn't last a whole day anymore. So far I'm happy with the battery on the Stylo 4, it lasts about as long as my work iPhone 7+, and could go 2 days on a charge. I haven't noticed the sound and camera quality issues that other reviews have mentioned, I think the Amazon Prime version may use better components than the carrier models. I've had much faster performance out of the Stylo 4 with very little lag. One thing that could have been improved is the notification LED, it's only red where the 5X would change color depending on the notification.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Much better than other unlocked options at this price
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the nicest phone I have used close to this price range (purchased for under 200. I bought it for a family member and now I'm hooked, even though my galaxy is better on paper. The interface is slick and responsive and the stylus is really a great addition in this price range. Feels as fluid to use as a high end samsung galaxy product, amd it might be nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Moderate_runner

customer_reviews.title: Better than 3
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone, I have used the Stylo 3 as my main phone for 6 months. decided to try out the new stylo. this is how they compared to me. Screen, stylo 4 better quality looks sharper Build quality, stylo 4 looks like a premium phone Battery life, about the same both are good Software/OS, stylo 4 android 8 better than 7. You can't change the resolution on this model. But it will let you change it on gaming apps. Hardware, stylo 4 processor and ram much better Calling quality, about the same
customer_reviews.author: Jric79

customer_reviews.title: The truth from a stylo 3 owner
customer_reviews.text: Its a downgrade from stylo 3 Pros Screen size Cons! Cant switch out battery if needed Speaker has a plasticky cheap tin sound Stylus @ the bottom Stylo 3 is much better This ones going back Maybe LG will get it right on the stylo 5
customer_reviews.author: di

customer_reviews.title: Software glitches from the start
customer_reviews.text: The positives, this phone screen is huge, it's fast, and the camera works great. The negatives, my phone, and this might not be the same for all of them, has lots of software glitches. The phone won't update. I can't mess with settings unless I restart the phone, it just kicks me out otherwise. The ringtones will randomly change. It's all rather annoying as you can imagine. It wouldn't update from the moment I turned it on but I didn't notice the rest until it was too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: John Calchera

customer_reviews.title: it is 3GB RAM - bad camera
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My biggest concern was about RAM because the same phone t-mobile sells for $250 at their locations, but RAM at their phones shows 1.9 GB. This one is 3 GB RAM and performance is better Update: I still like the phone, but camera is really bad. in fact front camera takes better pictures than rear camera. But for the price I bought (180) I guess cannot complain too much...
customer_reviews.author: DP&SB

customer_reviews.title: No NFC?
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty good deal on an inexpensive phone with higher end features. I do enjoy the fact that for the money it employs technologies that would have cost more money. I would have given it 5 stars but the one glaring omission is the lack of NFC. This I believe is due to it being an "Amazon" version and Amazon does not want you to pay at the retailer thus effectively cutting into its bottom line. Overall for an unlocked phone and decent tech specs I would recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: VisualAces

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Was the best choice so far i did buying this phone, great image quality, works with all mobile operators here in US and outside, battery is extremely good for heavy users, recommend a good case to protect, pen works great (no big diference with note) if has more 1gb of ram will benefit but honestly by now after 2weeks never had performance issues, sound could be better but its decent, cameras also could be better but they are also decent, and its in this 2 aspects there a huge diference with Note 9 ($$$$$) not doubts ... a must have!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renato Pinto

customer_reviews.title: I don't know why you'd need a $1000 phone.
customer_reviews.text: I say that, because this $250 phone (which I fortunately got on sale for $209) is just phenomenal, especially for the price. It's bullet fast, has a *gorgeous* 6.2" screen that is outstanding for movies, youtube, etc. a 13 MP camera that takes great pics, 1080p, 60 fps videos, you can take notes on the screen with the stylus, the list goes on. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff-66

customer_reviews.title: Stylo 4, You're Going To Love It
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Stylo/Android person. I started with a Stylo 2 which I loved, I had two Stylo 3's which we're terrible, no memory at all. Now, the Stylo 4.... It's amazing!! Memory is doubled. The screen in vibrant and bold. The features and extras are amazing. The only con... They push the 6.2 size large screen. I can tell No difference between the Stylo 3 and the Stylo 4. It measures less than 1/2 inch wider and 1/2 inch taller. With that minor detail, it's 100% better than the Stylo 2 or 3. Kudos LG on your Stylo 4.
customer_reviews.author: AngWms

customer_reviews.title: Deal of the year
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how lucky I was to find this phone on sale. I paid 179.99 for this huge nice display. The battery performs well. Call quality is good. They only thing negative is the smooth plastic back. You will need a case or you will have fingerprints and scratches galore. I know the pictures show a back that is not a fingerprint magnet. This is the 3GB ram version, there is a 2GB sold as well. The one pictured is the 2 GB version, everything looks the same except the back of the phone. Anyway, still a great phone loaded with great software perks.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality phone...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible camera!!! The old LG G5 was a much better quality phone. I bought it for my dad as an upgrade because it has a bigger screen. The quality is a big down grade! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bonny chu

customer_reviews.title: Get it now!
customer_reviews.text: I actually had to replace my now broken Note 8 with this Stylo 4. It was last minute, and I really needed a new phone. And let me tell you....the battery is much better, it's more lightweight, and the stylus is more smoother on the screen than the Note. And, thanks to Amazon's monthly payments and recent price drop, I've got a phone that is amazing and budget!
customer_reviews.author: Rich'Kelz

customer_reviews.title: Not all LG Stylo 4's are created equal....
customer_reviews.text: If you don't do your homework on the various LG Stylo 4's provided by carriers you'll end up with a less current model.... this Amazon version has to be the best one available and I would have installed all those Amazon apps that came pre-installed on mine anyway.... you might think you'll save money by jumping on a carrier deal, but I still can't understand why this one was so inexpensive at $249.... It's a great phone and I'm glad I didn't have to pay more....
customer_reviews.author: C. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions!!!! I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!
customer_reviews.text: IM FURIOUS!!!! Got this phone just a few months ago and already its been malfunctioning. The screen freezes then shuts down, if you're on a video call while that happens you cant even power off the phone to reset it. I have to hold the power and volume down button for it to restart. Then once you open a chat to take a pic with flash on using the camera in the chat window it flashes then the screen goes white. On top of that my flashlight JUST stopped working. It comes on for literally a second and comes off sometimes doesn't come on at all. Tried flashlight apps and its the same result. I want my money back!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian & Beth Kirton

customer_reviews.title: Poor cell tower connection
customer_reviews.text: After working with ATT customer service for a couple of hours it was determined that a new system card was needed. Off to the ATT store. New system card and while at the store it connected to a network. 24 hr later no connection to a network. Wifes phone is a Samsung S7 showing 3 bars works with no problem side by side to the Stylo 4.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything good Except
customer_reviews.text: the phone conversation. I really like this phone and this is my 9th smart phone (including all LG Stylus phones). Only one disappointment, and that's when I have a phone conversation. The quality and clarity of voice coming through ear speaker is sub-par compare to even the old generations of Stylus phones. I can't phantom how can the LG F##@up the most basic part of a cell phone which is the voice clarity and being able to talk on the phone like the cell phones of 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: dostoevsky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great. Nice upgrade from a Stylo 3. Popped in my Cricket SIM and it provisioned immediately. I think the cameras are fine. Has Fast charging with the OEM cable.
customer_reviews.author: Turbodonkey

customer_reviews.title: Overall quality of phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone isn't compatible with some apps that I would like to use like FITBIT, google translate, and a few others. I like the idea of it having a stylus. Its really helpful when having to write notes. Haven't had any issues with anything randomly crashing. I can run multiple apps at the same time without it crashing which is really nice. But battery life only last around 12 hrs which kinda sucks. Overall not too bad of a phone
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone overall Pros: I think the screen is a great size and it looks really good Good speed. Love the fingerprint scanner Phone call sound quality is good Not much noticeable lag Multi window/ true multi tasking Comes with its own stylus Cons Cannot use sd cards as adoptable storage Overall sound quality is bad. Need headphones to enjoy videos or music Stylus falls out if you drop your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great phone excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent phone for the money! Got it activated and added to my AT&T plan and we have no complaints, it's very responsive, call quality is excellent, sound is very good, the screen is large, the camera is not the best but it will get the job done and the stylus is very handy. Overall this is a good phone for everyday use, it has 3Gb of RAM and 32Gb of internal storage, we dropped a 128Gb micro SD card in it it's good to go! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Flatwoods 66

customer_reviews.title: Good first phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew it's his first phone. Love that it has the Ctype charger makes it easier for him to plug in. Only things I would have liked it to have would be NFC and wireless charging.
customer_reviews.author: erick

customer_reviews.title: Battery Drain Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift to my mother in Cuba. After barely more than a month of use, the battery started to drain in less than 20 minutes after a full recharge. Unfortunately I can’t replace it because it would take a lot of time to get it back in the U.S. and warranty expires today 1/31/19. My advice: don’t buy this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Yannis

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't Do It Again!
customer_reviews.text: Used the LG Stylo 4 for a few weeks. I had call drops, and apps that closed during use. Also had many times where I couldn't get back to the home screen without having to turn off the phone and do a restart. I wouldn't recommend it nor would I buy it again! Sorry LG, I returned it to Amazon for another cell phone from another company!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommended phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this phone, totally satisfied with quality product and performance, a cheap phone with excellent features. Touch screen is very attractive and works great, smooth and clear. Pics are not the best I have seen but enough for most not pro purposes
customer_reviews.author: Randall Ruiz Parajeles

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: First I will say it sure is a sleek nice looking phone with lots of features, however call quality really suffered it would break up your voice every 20-30 seconds causing a pausing in the line, to the point where you cant hear the caller & cannot be heard during these pauses
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my Droid Moro Z Force which uaed to have excellent battery life until an update turned it into a hand warmer. I hesitated to buy a phone from Amazon, but I used my upgrade to get an iPhone8 Plus for my wife. Desperate for a new ohone and having always been a "Note" fan I gave this unlocked ohone a try. I am so glad I did. Verizon added it to my account with no issues. This ohone has great battery life, decent speed, sound and and a great screen. My in small complaint is that Amazon loads bloatware you may want to remove. I am very pleased with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful in NC

customer_reviews.title: Kept foreclosing apps and error messages
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this phone. LG's normally are excellent, unfortunately when I received the phone as soon as I turned it on apps kept foreclosing and everytime I made a call error messages would pop up. I'm over 70$ down turning the phone on and accessories I've purchased for this phone. Also I should mention they will not replace the phone the only thing they will do is a refund. The phone is suppose to be new, but never came with the stylo pin. Took it to a metro store and he told me it didn't appear to be new, or even a real LG phone. These phone's at Metro are $150 in store. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chantalle Bourque

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade for Parent
customer_reviews.text: My dad was in need of a phone upgrade. The phone is large, easy to use, and smart. You don’t have to have an Amazon account to use it. But there are pre-loaded app toward Amazon. There is expendable memory to add a SD card. Also, we have T-Mobile and it worked with no problems. He has be using it for a month now with no issues. I highly recommend it and you can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Bugs
customer_reviews.text: It is Ok for a cheap phone, but I would never buy it again. It has several annoying bugs. The worst part is the phone feature itself. The screen will go dim and jam up during a call. This means the screen goes so dim you can't see the keys and then if you need to press a key for those annoying robocalls (e.g. press 1 for this and 2 for that) it won't work. Spend a little more money on a better phone if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: great phone without a high price tag
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone it has a long battery life usually goes for four to five days before it needs a charge and it charges very quickly. It's sleek looking and the screen is large enough to watch movies or videos without missing half the story line cause of the screen being so small. Has different security locks that keep others off your phone like face recognition, fingerprint recognition and other type security. So I can just touch it with my finger and it starts up and I'm ready to text. What I especially like is no one else can get on my phone to use it without me first opening it up.
customer_reviews.author: Maro

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with Virgin Mobile
customer_reviews.text: So I'm disappointed. I bought this phone thinking I could use it as a replacement for my Samsung J3 ( 2016 ) using my existing Virgin Mobile SIM card/account. I contacted Virgin Mobile and was told this particular phone would not work. I would have to find and purchase one from their online store. I had to cancel the next 4 months of payments and luckily someone else in my house was able to switch his existing account and use it for Metro PCS. Other than all of that, the phone is nice, screen is big and I have no complaints about the phone itself.
customer_reviews.author: kiki83doll

customer_reviews.title: Looks can be receiving, but good price
customer_reviews.text: The phone looked great when I received it. It does not withstand time very well though. The back is plastic but the pregame feels like aluminum. The phone slows down a lot after a while shuts off on its own without reason. It heats up a lot when playing games. Fingerprint scanner is not always responsive. For the price it's ok but there are so many things you have to give up for a cheap price. The best thing overall is having a big screen. I gave this to my brother for Christmas. He has been using it for a year now and feels like throwing the phone against a wall every time it freezes or shuts off.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Decent Phone, Poor Quality Camera Pics
customer_reviews.text: Phone works well for the price. I got the phone on Amazon for $179 when they had a sale going on. I would not pay more for it though. Compared to my older iPhone 6s Plus the camera quality of the style 4 is poor. Picture quality from rear facing camera is not as clear as old iPhone. Front facing camera takes decent quality selfies (same as iPhone). I ended up going back to my iPhone 6s Plus and using the stylo 4 for recording video and my daughters volleyball tournaments. The phone is in a basic case and has taken a few direct Volleyball hits (phone in a camera stand) and works fine. Battery lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this phone and I .
customer_reviews.text: The volume is not loud enough. Also, when on a call the screen goes black and this makes it difficult when you need the keyboard. It's a real pain. If I had known this about this phone I would not have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn K. Wilke

customer_reviews.title: Great price, Good Stylus, not laggy, Great for Straight Talk.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great! I switched from an unlocked Verizon Note 4 to this Stylo 4 for the AT&T network on my Straight Talk account. The stylus isn't as great as the Note's but it is still nice. I don't play games with the phone, just internet email and work-notes with the stylus. Excellent phone for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: No regrets, good phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone was a great deal. I'm in the u.s. and have metro pcs. I called them and had the phone activated no issues in about 10 minutes. The phone itself is nice. Good screen size and quality. Camera quality isn't the absolute best but it's definitely not bad either, I love taking pictures and am not disappointed. Even with all the preloaded Amazon apps there's still plenty of room to add all the apps I wanted. Battery seems to last. I've had no problems worth connection or speed. If you're looking for a large,nice looking, functional phone without selling a kidney this phone is great
customer_reviews.author: T_cruz16

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was going to purchase the LG stylo 4 from my local phone store. I was shopping on Amazon for a case for the phone and I noticed that Amazon had the phone I wanted on sale, so I purched it. I could not be happier! Easy to move the sim card over and not a problem with the phone. The phone has a great battery life, I use my phone all day and I have yet to have to stop what I am doing too charge the phone when I am away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from the LG Stylo 4 — worthless
customer_reviews.text: You can’t adjust the settings on this phone, making it virtually worthless.
customer_reviews.author: J. Redding

customer_reviews.title: LG Stylo 4
customer_reviews.text: Great unlocked android phone. Works perfect with TMobile. For the price, it does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Good battery. Phone is good
customer_reviews.text: Phone works. Its a little slow but not bad. Call quality is good. Speaker shoukd be a little louder. Battery life is good. The finger print stopped working lg will fix it at no charge but it will take approx 2 weeks and thats not acceptable, so no finger print for me. I don't know if the finger print is a known problem but.... The phone is good
customer_reviews.author: Ace Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the money. Big screen and unless you are gamer the specs hold up to everyday usage just fine. The battery is good holding up for a full day unless I really push it. The screen is has above average resolution and the size is excellent, which for me trumps all. Let's be fair this phone is not the equal of flagship offerings from the major mfg's but for those of us that use it to talk text e-mail and watch videos it punches way above it's weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: My first smartphone
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for 1 month now. I love it! I have no issues with the Amazon pre-loaded apps. At first there were adds onscreen but they were easily stopped. I inserted an SD card and my Pure Talk (uses AT&T towers) sim card and it was immediately ready to use. I have downloaded a few apps I like and have had no issues with anything. Works beautifully, would recommend to anyone wanting an unlocked phone.
customer_reviews.author: jomar

customer_reviews.title: LG Stylo 4 for 1/4 the price of service providers
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new smartphone. I love LG phones, sound quality, v]\camera and value for the money. Did not want to pay $900 for one at Verizon. This option was a great deal. The Amazon app is not too annoying. Willing to put up with some marketing for the excellent price. Was even on special the week I ordered, went up $50 the next day..
customer_reviews.author: RickM

customer_reviews.title: Great phone without breaking the bank!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are on a budget and need a descent upgrade......get this phone! I really wanted and really nice Android and came across this Lg phone...works well with metro pcs... ( all I had to do is go to a metro Pcs store and had them transfer my old sim card to this new phone. the stylus is works well..get it and be proud that you got great phone without breaking the bank!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: This phone DOES work with Straight Talk
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great so far. This is my first LG phone, I've been a dedicated Samsung user from day one. I really like this phone. If you're looking for something to take studio quality pics or make 4k for your 'followers' this is not the phone for you. If you're looking for something to do everyday things on like IG, FB, Snapchat, shopping, games, watch videos, listen to music, make 1080p videos, semi basic photography, etc, then I'd suggest this phone.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Not sure yet. Will update
customer_reviews.text: Love the phone but getting a n identical replacement. Having a few issues with this particular phone. Screen flickers and sometimes goes back to the home screen for no reason. Getting a replacement and will update as to whether or not the next phone as the same issues
customer_reviews.author: vegaswillie

customer_reviews.title: Decent Phone But Has Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone last year. It's pretty good but it does not have Adobe flash and isn't compatible so it can't be dowloaded. I have to use my laptop for certain things. Plus, I shop on Amazon a lot so I use the app. I don't know why it's a problem but the phone goes black and white for a spell when browsing the app. I have to power it off and then wait for it to come around. Also when I am searching for GIFs on Twitter, I can only scroll down so far before the GIFs freeze up and I have to close the app.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Grace

customer_reviews.title: Data network dropped and refuses to connect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone without a single hitch, it ran smoothly and with no issues. Then, just last week, the network dropped. No warning. Just one day, poof! No data! I contacted AT&T, no help, then removed the sim card into my old phone...And it connected right away. If it wasn't for that terrible hiccup this phone would have been great, but now, there's no way I would reccomend this to anyone. No phone network? Then it's not a phone. I lost an interview, by the way, thanks to the dropped network. Ask yourself if you would risk your daily life without a phone connection. DON'T. BUY. THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor product quality
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to give a 1 rating because it's a nice looking phone with many coo and useful features. I'm sure there are customers who's phone works good. This phone was ordered new because I've had many problems with used. The packaging and ither things were good. No manual. Doon the keyboard did not work. Buttons didn't always react when touched. After that the screen sometimes showed halos and you could see the insides of the screen. Then after about a week it did not connect to wifi even though the setting said excellent signal. Overall a nice looking phone but really bad quality control on everyone's part including the manufacturer. Too bad. Joel Rubin
customer_reviews.author: Joel Rubin

customer_reviews.title: You will love this phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone is outstanding and also a great value. It is only $159 and in my opinion, there is nothing in this price range that comes close. Even for twice the price. Pros: Extremely Smooth and Fast (compared to other mid-range devices) Works With All Major Carriers (including Verizon/sprint/Total Wireless) Great Display USB-C Charging Fast Charging Capability Great Stylus Large Display Average-Good Battery Life 3 GB of RAM (compared to 2 GB with Metro PCS version) Cons: Back is prone to scratching easily No NFC Average Camera. if u are looking for a nice smart phone that doesn't cost a fortune, this is it. this phone has some really cool features.
customer_reviews.author: Afrim

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Samsung phones. This is the first LG Stylo 4 I have purchased. I love it more now than a Samsung. I love the battery saver. the split screens, the time out when using an app or playing a game. The only vault I have with it is that it does not have the voice mail icon. You have to use your number to retrieve any messages. You have to check this on regular bases, as there is no notifications for that feature. Besides that issue, I would highly recommend this style of phone. Great phone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It's Not My V30
customer_reviews.text: Hey, I wasn't expecting it to be. That's comparing an $800 phone to a $250 phone. I love the big screen. The stylus is cool. Haven't figured it out quite yet but it's only been a day. It does hang up a bit where my V30 is silky smooth. I'm assuming that's the lower level processor and ram amounts. It's about on par with my Moto G6 in performance. Not bad at all but a little slow at times. Either way, it works for me and you can't beat the PRICE. Find a GOOD slim case for it. The couple two layers cases I bought for it really bulked it up. Totally ruins the nice feel of the phone.
customer_reviews.author: myJimpants

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if not for the cameras
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say, the battery is AMAZING. It's even better on the medium power saving mode. Great fingerprint reader, snappy, not too much bloatware to really get rid of. It's very thin and doesn't run hot too often. The only letdown is the camera. Both are very grainy if not in the right light. The zoom feature on the back camera makes it look like you're using a flip from 2009. Otherwise I highly reccomend it. Great budget phone
customer_reviews.author: EasterTheEgg

customer_reviews.title: An incredible value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your use case for this, it really can compete with a phone double or triple the price. I don't need a top of the line phone, just one that checks a few basic points: Enough storage to not be obnoxious everytime I want to install an app, decent enough ram that it doesn't close an app as soon as I switch to another, and a good enough cpu to not be laggy or unresponsive. It's really hard to find a phone at this price point that doesn't require some kind of compromise in one or more of those areas, but this phone does it all plus extra features (like stylus/finger print reader.)
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: This phone the 1st time LG has disappointed me
customer_reviews.text: I have been a loyal LG phone owner. However I am VERY disappointed with this Stylo 4. Very rarely will I get more than 3 bars of signal. I know the problem is with this device because I had the Stylo 3 plus and had full signal strength in the same locations that I'm getting crappy signal service with this phone. Very slow at opening apps, also drops apps randomly.
customer_reviews.author: James Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Like a lot, just wish the camera was a bit sharper
customer_reviews.text: Love the stylus and the price! Due to arthritic hands I find the stylus to be a requirement when buying a phone, but flatly refuse to pay nearly $1,000 for another Galaxy Note. This phone is easy to use and does everything I need (and more), just wish the camera was better.
customer_reviews.author: StlVicki

customer_reviews.title: Great budget phone for what I need
customer_reviews.text: My Moto phone was acting up and I needed something new. I do a lot of reading on my kindle app so I was looking for something with a large display, but didn't want to spend a fortune. This phone has everything I need. I can listen to my podcasts and audio books, read my kindle books, text/email. I'm a big amazon user so having the pre installed apps works for me. The speaker isn't the greatest but it's not a big deal. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bookd

customer_reviews.title: Good budget phone, one problem though....
customer_reviews.text: Great budget phone. Checked every box I was looking for. I had a major issue though that caused me to return TWO units for the exact same thing. Every time I charged it the SD card would be ejected. No idea why but would lose everything saved there. Called tech support for LG on both phones and they were unable to diagnose. Had the style 2 for a long time and really wanted this phone to work out. Aside from this, really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Tidwelljw

customer_reviews.title: So pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Im using the phone to do this review. Never have I ordered a used phone online. I am so pleased with it. The price was great and all I did was call Metro PCS (my carrier) and they activated it within 5 minutes. There was no damage as far as scratches or dings. You would think it was brand new if I hadn't told you. So pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CarieL

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is very impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using refurbished phones for the last few years thar haven't ladted more than a year. Once again it was time to find another. Thank you Amazon for having a great phone with a payment option. This Stylo4 is hands down the best phone I have ever owned! Downloads are very fast. The size is perfect so are case options. I had no issues at all activating it with Verizon. No cost involved at all. I could write a very long and detailed review but I'm keeping it short. BUY ONE!!
customer_reviews.author: RobertP.

customer_reviews.title: Not much battery power
customer_reviews.text: Phone is OK, does not perform like top of the line phones as far as I can tell, however, the biggest beef is that the product battery does not last more than two days and leaves me hanging a lot of the time without power. I have t-Mobile for coverage and my HTC worked just fine and held out for 8 or 9 days before the battery ran out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is pretty cool! Nice big screen and camera it looks and feels cool I have had it for a couple months and I love it. I ordered this phone off of her and then I went to Wal Mart amd bought a SIM card from straight talk popped it in and it works great no problems with this phone and no complaints money well spent I would recommend this phone I upgraded to thia phone from a ZTE and this looks and feels much better hope this helps

I recommend LG just not LG preloaded with tons of Amazon apps. Totally suxs
customer_reviews.author: traciraybe

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is a great phone for the money!! I've had this phone for about 2 months now, and I can't think of anything about it that I don't like. Screen is big, camera works great, sound is loud enough (I saw some reviews dissing on sound loudness), plenty of room for apps, Bluetooth works as expected, and battery goes at least two days with moderate use. I can't believe people pay $700 or even $800 for a new phone when this one is available for under $250. I'd strongly recommend for anyone looking for a solid phone that is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: CubsFan1989

customer_reviews.title: 6 Months later
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone in December for under $200. Now 6 months later the the bluetooth and the flashlight have stopped working a few days ago. Up until these issues it was a great phone and still kind of is because the not having bluetooth and a flashlight is not too inportant to me. It still runs fast, takes awesome pictures/video and the battery lasts for the whole day. Also the loud speaker isn't the best, but I already knew that before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: A. P.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. It responds quickly even with several apps open at once. Easy to use and it is a bigger screen than my previous phone. Love the included stylus which makes it easier to select the letter/number keys on the screen. You can even write a memo using the stylus. Only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating was that it was a lot more expensive that previous phone.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in January of 2019. I never really liked it. I am not a power user; I mostly do work email, internet browsing, and stream music. This phone has always been slow and lacks response, IMO. Cameras are below average. Battery life, for me, was pretty good. 3 of 5 stars, mostly for price. On that note, I knew I was buying a lower end phone. After 11 months of hobbling along, I am already upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: BnkrGuy920

customer_reviews.title: I keep coming back to it
customer_reviews.text: I normally purchase a new cell phone every three months. I keep coming back and using this cell phone again and again. I normally sell my phone when I’m done with it but I keep this one laying around and I keep switching back to it because I don’t like their replacement as well as I like this one. It has excellent battery life and I plan on replacing it when I come out with The stylo five. I wish I had more ram my only complaint is slow charging.
customer_reviews.author: 23 guy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Basically to sum things up quick and simple, if you have $1,000 for a new Galaxy or iPhone, and want or require one , by all means get it, but if you're looking for the next best thing at a affordable price , this is it and will not be beaten. Of course to save $700 you sacrifice a few things, sound quality could be better, but like I said if you'd rather spend 700 more $$$ for a few simple things that are completely manageable , by all means do

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but that,s it
customer_reviews.text: The phone i was sent is sometimes unresponsive and even gets a little laggy and locks up from time to time. Only had it for 3 days and i,m going to return it. Dunno if i got a lemon or not but will not take the chance on another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO. NOT. BUY.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for all of 3.5 months. Let me start by saying that the amount of Amazon apps that are loaded are insane and unnecesary. But to be fair, many reviews reflect this. For a while, my texts have been glitching here and there. My phone is now frozen on the "lg" page and refuses to turn off, turn on, or do anything else. I am so frustrated with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam12345

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone all the way round! It has a great screen resolution, a great camera, it's unlocked and compatible with straight Talk and I'm loving the stylus pen! Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Nexus 6, it was freezing and then restarting on its own with more frequency. This LG phone has a good battery life, is fairly quick to charge, and faster than my Nexus 6. The only thing is that the aspect ratio of the screen is different, it's long and narrow but not as good for me when I play some casual phone games. But it's actually easier to carry around than a wider phone. I was deciding whether to buy this LG or the similarly priced Moto G6, and I like the LG better with its larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.
